pages.text: The roles of $(thing)Lignite$() and $(thing)Bituminous Coal$() have been expanded in AutoTerraFirmaCraft, with both now being usable as fuel in $(l:mechanics/bloomery)Bloomeries$() and $(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)Blast Furnaces$().$(br2)As the title would suggest, charcoal can be converted to $(thing)Lignite$() which can be converted to $(thing)Bituminous Coal$().$(br2)$(l:mechanics/charcoal_pit)Info on making Charcoal here.$()

pages.title: Lignite from Coal Block
pages.text: Blocks of Coal can be produced in a $(thing)Mechanical Press$() by compacting eight Charcoal and one $(thing)Peat$().
$(thing)Burn Time: 108 seconds$()$(br2)The Charcoal -> Lignite process converts 8 Charcoal into 9 Lignite
$(thing)Burn Time: 132 seconds$()$(br2)This represents a total conversion of $(thing)864s -> 1188s$(), an increase of 37.5%.

Bituminous Coal burns much $(thing)Hotter$() than Lignite. Using it to fuel a $(l:mechanics/charcoal_forge)Charcoal Forge$() can completely negate the need to use $(thing)Bellows$(). Using it to fuel a $(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)Blast Furnace$() can negate the use of $(thing)Bellows$() and a $(thing)Tuyere$().$(br2)Combining 3 Lignite and 2 $(l:patchouli:create_integration/sand_crushing#black_sand)Coke Powder$() in a $(thing)Mechanical Mixer$() will produce 3 Bituminous Coal.

pages.title: Coal Forges
pages.text: Bituminous Coal can also be used $(thing)Superheat$() a $(l:patchouli:create_integration/coal_forges)Coal Forge$().$(br2)This will allow it to reach the highest temperatures for Basin Recipes or Boiler Heating.
